trans-unit.source: SQL Database Disaster Recovery
trans-unit.target: SQL Database Disaster Recovery

trans-unit.source: Learn how to recover a database from a regional datacenter outage or failure with the Azure SQL Database Geo-replication and Geo-restore capabilities.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to recover a database from a regional datacenter outage or failure with the Azure SQL Database Geo-replication and Geo-restore capabilities.

trans-unit.source: Azure SQL Database's offers a few outage recovery capabilities:
trans-unit.target: Azure SQL Database's offers a few outage recovery capabilities:

trans-unit.source: Active Geo-Replication <linkText>(blog)</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: Active Geo-Replication <linkText>(blog)</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Standard Geo-Replication <linkText>(blog)</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: Standard Geo-Replication <linkText>(blog)</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Geo-restore <linkText>(blog)</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: Geo-restore <linkText>(blog)</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: To learn about preparing for disaster and when to recover your database, visit our <linkText>Design for Business Continuity</linkText><title></title> page.
trans-unit.target: To learn about preparing for disaster and when to recover your database, visit our <linkText>Design for Business Continuity</linkText><title></title> page.

trans-unit.source: The recovery operation impacts the application.
trans-unit.target: The recovery operation impacts the application.

trans-unit.source: It requires changing the SQL connection string and could result in permanent data loss.
trans-unit.target: It requires changing the SQL connection string and could result in permanent data loss.

trans-unit.source: Therefore it should be done only when the outage is likely to last longer than your application's RTO.
trans-unit.target: Therefore it should be done only when the outage is likely to last longer than your application's RTO.

trans-unit.source: When the application is deployed to production you should perform regular monitoring of the application health and use the following data points to assert that the recovery is warranted:
trans-unit.target: When the application is deployed to production you should perform regular monitoring of the application health and use the following data points to assert that the recovery is warranted:

trans-unit.source: Permanent connectivity failure from the application tier to the database.
trans-unit.target: Permanent connectivity failure from the application tier to the database.

trans-unit.source: Your Azure Portal shows an alert about an incident in the region with broad impact.
trans-unit.target: Your Azure Portal shows an alert about an incident in the region with broad impact.

trans-unit.source: You must configure <linkText>Standard Geo-Replication</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>Active Geo-Replication</linkText><title></title> to have a secondary database to use for failover.
trans-unit.target: You must configure <linkText>Standard Geo-Replication</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>Active Geo-Replication</linkText><title></title> to have a secondary database to use for failover.

trans-unit.source: Geo-Replication is only available for Standard and Premium databases.
trans-unit.target: Geo-Replication is only available for Standard and Premium databases.

trans-unit.source: In the event of an outage on the primary database, you can failover to a secondary database to restore availability.
trans-unit.target: In the event of an outage on the primary database, you can failover to a secondary database to restore availability.

trans-unit.source: To do this you will need to force terminate the continuous copy relationship.
trans-unit.target: To do this you will need to force terminate the continuous copy relationship.

trans-unit.source: For a full description of terminating continuous copy relationships go <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For a full description of terminating continuous copy relationships go <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Log in to the <linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: Log in to the <linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: On the left side of the screen select BROWSE and then select SQL Databases
trans-unit.target: On the left side of the screen select BROWSE and then select SQL Databases

trans-unit.source: Navigate to your database and select it.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to your database and select it.

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of your database blade select the Geo Replication map.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of your database blade select the Geo Replication map.

trans-unit.source: Under Secondaries right click on the row with the name of the database you want to recover to and select Stop.
trans-unit.target: Under Secondaries right click on the row with the name of the database you want to recover to and select Stop.

trans-unit.source: After the continuous copy relationship is terminated, you can configure your recovered database to be used by following the <linkText>Finalize a Recovered Database</linkText><title></title> guide.
trans-unit.target: After the continuous copy relationship is terminated, you can configure your recovered database to be used by following the <linkText>Finalize a Recovered Database</linkText><title></title> guide.

trans-unit.source: Use PowerShell to programmatically perform database recovery.
trans-unit.target: Use PowerShell to programmatically perform database recovery.

trans-unit.source: To terminate the relationship from the secondary database, use the <linkText>Stop-AzureSqlDatabaseCopy</linkText><title></title> cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: To terminate the relationship from the secondary database, use the <linkText>Stop-AzureSqlDatabaseCopy</linkText><title></title> cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: After the continuous copy relationship is terminated, you can configure your recovered database to be used by following the <linkText>Finalize a Recovered Database</linkText><title></title> guide.
trans-unit.target: After the continuous copy relationship is terminated, you can configure your recovered database to be used by following the <linkText>Finalize a Recovered Database</linkText><title></title> guide.

trans-unit.source: Use REST to programmatically perform database recovery.
trans-unit.target: Use REST to programmatically perform database recovery.

trans-unit.source: Get the database continuous copy using the <linkText>Get Database Copy</linkText><title></title> operation.
trans-unit.target: Get the database continuous copy using the <linkText>Get Database Copy</linkText><title></title> operation.

trans-unit.source: Stop the database continuous copy using the <linkText>Stop Database Copy</linkText><title></title> operation.
trans-unit.target: Stop the database continuous copy using the <linkText>Stop Database Copy</linkText><title></title> operation.

trans-unit.source: Use the secondary server name and database name in the Stop Database Copy request URI
trans-unit.target: Use the secondary server name and database name in the Stop Database Copy request URI

trans-unit.source: After the continuous copy relationship is terminated, you can configure your recovered database to be used by following the <linkText>Finalize a Recovered Database</linkText><title></title> guide.
trans-unit.target: After the continuous copy relationship is terminated, you can configure your recovered database to be used by following the <linkText>Finalize a Recovered Database</linkText><title></title> guide.

trans-unit.source: In the event of an outage of a database, you can recover your database from its latest geo redundant backup using Geo-Restore.
trans-unit.target: In the event of an outage of a database, you can recover your database from its latest geo redundant backup using Geo-Restore.

trans-unit.source: Recovering a database creates a new database.
trans-unit.target: Recovering a database creates a new database.

trans-unit.source: It is important to make sure the server you are recovering to has enough DTU capacity for the new database.
trans-unit.target: It is important to make sure the server you are recovering to has enough DTU capacity for the new database.

trans-unit.source: You can request an increase of this quota by <linkText>contacting support</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You can request an increase of this quota by <linkText>contacting support</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Log in to the <linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: Log in to the <linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: On the left side of the screen select NEW, then select Data and Storage, and then select SQL Database
trans-unit.target: On the left side of the screen select NEW, then select Data and Storage, and then select SQL Database

trans-unit.source: Select BACKUP as the source and then select the geo redundant backup you want to recover from.
trans-unit.target: Select BACKUP as the source and then select the geo redundant backup you want to recover from.

trans-unit.source: Specify the rest of the database properties and then click Create.
trans-unit.target: Specify the rest of the database properties and then click Create.

trans-unit.source: The database restore process will begin and can be monitored using NOTIFICATIONS on the left side of the screen.
trans-unit.target: The database restore process will begin and can be monitored using NOTIFICATIONS on the left side of the screen.

trans-unit.source: After the database is recovered you can configure it to be used by following the <linkText>Finalize a Recovered Database</linkText><title></title> guide.
trans-unit.target: After the database is recovered you can configure it to be used by following the <linkText>Finalize a Recovered Database</linkText><title></title> guide.

trans-unit.source: Use PowerShell to programmatically perform database recovery.
trans-unit.target: Use PowerShell to programmatically perform database recovery.

trans-unit.source: To start a Geo-Restore request, use the <linkText>start-AzureSqlDatabaseRecovery</linkText><title></title> cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: To start a Geo-Restore request, use the <linkText>start-AzureSqlDatabaseRecovery</linkText><title></title> cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: For a detailed walk through, please see our <linkText>how-to video</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For a detailed walk through, please see our <linkText>how-to video</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: After the database is recovered you can configure it to be used by following the <linkText>Finalize a Recovered Database</linkText><title></title> guide.
trans-unit.target: After the database is recovered you can configure it to be used by following the <linkText>Finalize a Recovered Database</linkText><title></title> guide.

trans-unit.source: Use REST to programmatically perform database recovery.
trans-unit.target: Use REST to programmatically perform database recovery.

trans-unit.source: Get your list of recoverable databases using the <linkText>List Recoverable Databases</linkText><title></title> operation.
trans-unit.target: Get your list of recoverable databases using the <linkText>List Recoverable Databases</linkText><title></title> operation.

trans-unit.source: Get the database you want to recover using the <linkText>Get Recoverable Database</linkText><title></title> operation.
trans-unit.target: Get the database you want to recover using the <linkText>Get Recoverable Database</linkText><title></title> operation.

trans-unit.source: Create the recovery request using the <linkText>Create Database Recovery Request</linkText><title></title> operation.
trans-unit.target: Create the recovery request using the <linkText>Create Database Recovery Request</linkText><title></title> operation.

trans-unit.source: Track the status of the recovery using the <linkText>Database Operation Status</linkText><title></title> operation.
trans-unit.target: Track the status of the recovery using the <linkText>Database Operation Status</linkText><title></title> operation.

trans-unit.source: After the database is recovered you can configure it to be used by following the <linkText>Finalize a Recovered Database</linkText><title></title> guide.
trans-unit.target: After the database is recovered you can configure it to be used by following the <linkText>Finalize a Recovered Database</linkText><title></title> guide.
